result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J. Milanowski

defendant.name: Milanowski, Adam J.
defendant.address: 1846 Pine Bluff Road, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam J Milanowski in court with attorney Ryan Drengler.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.

13CT414: OWI 2nd: Count 1:  37 days jail, $1,368.00 fine/costs, $26.45 pay blood draw costs. 18 mo revocation of driver's license, 18 mo IID effective today, DOT/AODA Assessment/Safety
13CT414: Count 2 Pac% .182% to be dismissed.

14CT77:  30 days jail, consecutive to 13CT414. $300 fine + costs.

13CF426: Count 1: I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent with count 2, but consecutive to any other sentence stayed:  24 mo Probation: Conditions: AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Pay Restitution $4,138.80. No contact with Randy Gloewski. Pay costs. 
13CF426: Count 2: I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent with count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence stayed:  24 mo Probation: Same conditions of probation. Pay costs.

14CF63: Count 1 to be DRI
14CF63: Count 2: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF426: Same conditions as 13CF426.  Pay costs.

14CF321: to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest on 13CT414: OWI 2nd: Count 1: 14CT77: 13CF426: Count 1: 13CF426: Count 2: 14CF63: Count 2: 
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CT414 Count 1, 14CF63 Count 2, 13CF426 count 1 & 2 and 14CT77 .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
14CF321 is Dismissed Read In.
13CT414 count 2 is Dismissed.
14CF63 Count 1 is Dismissed Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with agreement, but asks no further jail time or run concurrent in 14CT77. 

BY THE COURT: **********PROBATION********** 
13CT414: OWI 2nd: Count 1:   
37 days jail, (3 days credit) with huber any electronic monitor is up to the jail.  
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Jail will start today. Report immediately.
$1,368.00 fine/costs, 60 Days to pay or set up payment plan.
$26.45 pay blood draw costs. 
18 mo revocation of driver's license, 
18 mo IID effective today, 
DOT/AODA Assessment/Safety

14CT77: 30 days jail, consecutive to 13CT414.  (3 days credit) With huber:  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Pay $300 fine + costs+surcharges. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan.

13CF426: Count 1:  I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail (3 days credit), concurrent with count 2, but consecutive to any other sentence - stayed:  
24 mo Probation, is consecutive to the Jail Sentences in 13CT414 and 14CT77. 
Conditions: 
Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment, and be there only for hours of employment.  
Random urinalysis and drug testing.
Pay Restitution $4,138.80 for West Bend Mutual and ($825.00 for Randy Glodowsk - to be paid first). 
No contact with Randy Glodowski. 
Pay costs. 

13CF426: Count 2: : I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent with count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence (3 days credit) - stayed:  24 mo Probation, concurrent with Count 1, but consecutive to the Jail Sentence in 13CT414 & 14CT77: Same conditions of probation as Count 1. Pay costs.

14CF63: Count 2: I/S Sentence: 6 mo jail consecutive 13CF426 (3 days credit) - stayed: 
24 mo probation, concurrent with 13CF426, but consecutive to 13CT414 & 14CT77 Jail Sentences. 
Same conditions as 13CF426. Pay costs.

All cash bonds will be applied to fine/costs/restitution.

Court infoms of Appeal rights.
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report dated 02-18-15 (original filed in 13CT414)
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam J. Milanowski in court with attorney Sean Drury who appears for Atty Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Adam J. Milanowski in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty Drury indicates this matter is Atty Drenglers case, he is appearing specially today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Comply with conditions of all other bonds that he is currently under including 13CT414, 14CT77, 14CF63 and 13CF426.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $850 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.   Starts work on 8/18/14.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  8/25/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is represented by Atty Drury in other files. 
Court advises defendant to contact the Public Defender. 
Atty Knaapen makes correction.
